member.name: T:GpgApi.GpgDateTime
member.summary:
Represents a gpg datetime. This class is immutable.
Every public keys has an expiration date. This date can be either a datetime or "unlimited". Unlimited means that the key will never expire.

member.name: F:GpgApi.GpgDateTime.Unlimited
member.summary: Represents a "unlimited" datetime.

member.name: P:GpgApi.GpgDateTime.DateTime
member.summary: Gets the DateTime component of this instance.

member.name: P:GpgApi.GpgDateTime.IsUnlimited
member.summary: Gets the boolean that indicates whether the datetime represented by this instance is "unlimited".

member.name: M:GpgApi.GpgDateTime.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. By default, the new instance is an Unlimited datetime.

member.name: M:GpgApi.GpgDateTime.#ctor(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class to the specified datetime.
member.param: The datetime.

member.returns: The current datetime as a string.

member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer hash code.

member.name: M:GpgApi.GpgConvert.ToId(GpgApi.KeyAlgorithm)
member.summary: For more information, see gpg source code, file keygen.c line 1518.
member.remarks: GPG does not accept a "None" algorithm, so RSA is used by default. But you should not call this function with the "None" algorithm.

member.name: T:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the algorithm to be used to encrypt data. Those algorithms are symmetrics.
member.remarks: IDEA is not implemented in GPG because this algorithm is patented; more information here http://www.gnupg.org/faq/why-not-idea.en.html

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.None
member.summary: Default value.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.ThreeDes
member.summary: Encrypt using the 3DES algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.Cast5
member.summary: Encrypt using the Cast 5 (also named "cast 128") algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.BlowFish
member.summary: Encrypt using the Blowfish algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.Aes
member.summary: Encrypt using the AES algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.Aes192
member.summary: Encrypt using the AES-192 algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.Aes256
member.summary: Encrypt using the AES-256 algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.TwoFish
member.summary: Encrypt using the TwoFish algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.Camellia128
member.summary: Encrypt using the Camellia-128 algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.Camellia192
member.summary: Encrypt using the Camellia-192 algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.CipherAlgorithm.Camellia256
member.summary: Encrypt using the Camellia-256 algorithm.

member.name: T:GpgApi.KeyAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the algorithm to be used to encrypt and/or sign data. Those algorithms are asymmetrics.

member.summary: Default value.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyAlgorithm.RsaRsa
member.summary: Encrypt and sign data using the RSA algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyAlgorithm.RsaEncrypt
member.summary: Encrypt data using the RSA algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyAlgorithm.RsaSign
member.summary: Sign data using the RSA algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyAlgorithm.Dsa
member.summary: Sign data using the DSA algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyAlgorithm.ELGamal
member.summary: Encrypt data using the ElGamal algorithm.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyAlgorithm.DsaELGamal
member.summary: Encrypt and sign data using the DSA/ElGamal algorithm.

member.summary: Specifies the compression algorithm to be used by GPG when compressing the data.

member.summary: Zip algorithm.

member.name: T:GpgApi.KeyOwnerTrust
member.summary: Specifies the trust defined by the user on a public key.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyOwnerTrust.None
member.summary: The user do not trust the key.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyOwnerTrust.Marginal
member.summary: The user has a marginal trusta on the key.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyOwnerTrust.Full
member.summary: The user trusts the key.

member.name: F:GpgApi.KeyOwnerTrust.Ultimate
member.summary: The user trusts the key; this is the maximum trust you can have on a key. This is the default value for the keys created by the user himself.

member.name: T:GpgApi.GpgAddPhoto
member.summary: Adds a photo to the specified key.
member.remarks:
The format of the photo must be Jpeg (because GPG accepts only jpeg). GPG can't download remote files (http://..., ftp://..., etc.); so the path of the file must be a local file. If the photo is too big (in KB), this action method will NOT ask for a confirmation. So you can resize the image before adding it to the key.
Here is the list of used by this class.

member.name: M:GpgApi.GpgAddPhoto.#ctor(GpgApi.KeyId,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
